template.template: Template DB MySQL by Zabbix agent
template.name: Template DB MySQL by Zabbix agent
template.description:
Requirements for template operation: 1.Install Zabbix agent and MySQL client. 2.Copy Template_DB_MySQL.conf into folder with Zabbix agent configuration (/etc/zabbix/zabbix_agentd.d/ by default). Don't forget restart zabbix-agent. 3.Create MySQL user for monitoring. For example: CREATE USER 'zbx_monitor'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY '<password>'; GRANT USAGE,REPLICATION CLIENT,PROCESS,SHOW DATABASES,SHOW VIEW ON *.* TO 'zbx_monitor'@'%'; For more information read the MYSQL documentation https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/grant.html , please. 4.Create .my.cnf in home directory of Zabbix agent for Linux (/var/lib/zabbix by default ) or my.cnf in c:\ for Windows. For example: [client] user=zbx_monitor password=<password>
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/384189-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-db-mysql
Template tooling version used: 0.35

item.name: MySQL: Get status variables
item.description: The item gets server global status information.

item.name: MySQL: Uptime
item.description: The number of seconds that the server has been up.

item.name: MySQL: Aborted clients per second
item.description: The number of connections that were aborted because the client died without closing the connection properly.

item.name: MySQL: Aborted connections per second
item.description: The number of failed attempts to connect to the MySQL server.

item.name: MySQL: Connection errors accept per second
item.description: Number of errors that occurred during calls to accept() on the listening port.

item.name: MySQL: Connection errors internal per second
item.description: Number of refused connections due to internal server errors, for example out of memory errors, or failed thread starts.

item.name: MySQL: Connection errors max connections per second
item.description: Number of refused connections due to the max_connections limit being reached.

item.name: MySQL: Connection errors peer address per second
item.description: Number of errors while searching for the connecting client IP address.

item.name: MySQL: Connection errors select per second
item.description: Number of errors during calls to select() or poll() on the listening port. The client would not necessarily have been rejected in these cases.

item.name: MySQL: Connection errors tcpwrap per second
item.description: Number of connections the libwrap library refused.

item.name: MySQL: Connections per second
item.description: The number of connection attempts (successful or not) to the MySQL server.

item.name: MySQL: Max used connections
item.description: The maximum number of connections that have been in use simultaneously since the server started.

item.name: MySQL: Threads cached
item.description: The number of threads in the thread cache.

item.name: MySQL: Threads connected
item.description: The number of currently open connections.

item.name: MySQL: Threads created
item.description: The number of threads created to handle connections. If Threads_created is big, you may want to increase the thread_cache_size value. The cache miss rate can be calculated as Threads_created/Connections.

item.name: MySQL: Threads running
item.description: The number of threads that are not sleeping.

item.name: MySQL: Buffer pool efficiency
item.description: The item shows how effectively the buffer pool is serving reads.

item.name: MySQL: Buffer pool utilization
item.description: Ratio of used to total pages in the buffer pool.

item.name: MySQL: Created tmp files on disk
item.description: How many temporary files mysqld has created.

item.name: MySQL: Created tmp tables on disk
item.description: The number of internal on-disk temporary tables created by the server while executing statements.

item.name: MySQL: Created tmp tables on memory
item.description: The number of internal temporary tables created by the server while executing statements.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool pages free
item.description: The total size of the InnoDB buffer pool, in pages.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool pages total
item.description: The total size of the InnoDB buffer pool, in pages.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool read requests
item.description: The number of logical read requests.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool read requests per second
item.description: The number of logical read requests per second.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool reads
item.description: The number of logical reads that InnoDB could not satisfy from the buffer pool, and had to read directly from disk.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool reads per second
item.description: The number of logical reads per second that InnoDB could not satisfy from the buffer pool, and had to read directly from disk.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB row lock time
item.description: The total time spent in acquiring row locks for InnoDB tables, in milliseconds.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB row lock time max
item.description: The maximum time to acquire a row lock for InnoDB tables, in milliseconds.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB row lock waits
item.description: The number of times operations on InnoDB tables had to wait for a row lock.

item.name: MySQL: Slow queries per second
item.description: The number of queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds.

item.name: MySQL: Bytes received
item.description: The number of bytes received from all clients.

item.name: MySQL: Bytes sent
item.description: The number of bytes sent to all clients.

item.name: MySQL: Command Delete per second
item.description: The Com_delete counter variable indicates the number of times the delete statement has been executed.

item.name: MySQL: Command Insert per second
item.description: The Com_insert counter variable indicates the number of times the insert statement has been executed.

item.name: MySQL: Command Select per second
item.description: The Com_select counter variable indicates the number of times the select statement has been executed.

item.name: MySQL: Command Update per second
item.description: The Com_update counter variable indicates the number of times the update statement has been executed.

item.name: MySQL: Queries per second
item.description: The number of statements executed by the server. This variable includes statements executed within stored programs, unlike the Questions variable.

item.name: MySQL: Questions per second
item.description: The number of statements executed by the server. This includes only statements sent to the server by clients and not statements executed within stored programs, unlike the Queries variable.

discovery_rule.name: Replication discovery
discovery_rule.description: If "show slave status" returns Master_Host, "Replication: *" items are created.

item_prototype.name: MySQL: Replication Slave status {#MASTERHOST}
item_prototype.description: The item gets status information on essential parameters of the slave threads.

item_prototype.name: MySQL: Replication Seconds Behind Master {#MASTERHOST}
item_prototype.description: The number of seconds that the slave SQL thread is behind processing the master binary log. A high number (or an increasing one) can indicate that the slave is unable to handle events from the master in a timely fashion.

item_prototype.name: MySQL: Replication Slave IO Running {#MASTERHOST}
item_prototype.description: Whether the I/O thread for reading the master's binary log is running. Normally, you want this to be Yes unless you have not yet started replication or have explicitly stopped it with STOP SLAVE.

item_prototype.name: MySQL: Replication Slave SQL Running {#MASTERHOST}
item_prototype.description: Whether the SQL thread for executing events in the relay log is running. As with the I/O thread, this should normally be Yes.

trigger_prototype.name: MySQL: Replication lag is too high (over {$MYSQL.REPL_LAG.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
MySQL: The slave I/O thread is not running
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} Whether the I/O thread for reading the master's binary log is running.

trigger_prototype.name: MySQL: The slave I/O thread is not connected to a replication master

dependency.name: MySQL: The slave I/O thread is not running

trigger_prototype.name: MySQL: The SQL thread is not running
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} Whether the SQL thread for executing events in the relay log is running.

dependency.name: MySQL: The slave I/O thread is not running

trigger.name: MySQL: Failed to get items (no data for 30m)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} Zabbix has not received data for items for the last 30 minutes.

trigger.expression: {Template DB MySQL by Zabbix agent:mysql.version["{$MYSQL.HOST}","{$MYSQL.PORT}"].diff()}=1 and {Template DB MySQL by Zabbix agent:mysql.version["{$MYSQL.HOST}","{$MYSQL.PORT}"].strlen()}>0
trigger.name: MySQL: Version has changed (new version value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} MySQL version has changed. Ack to close.

trigger.name: MySQL: Service has been restarted (uptime < 10m)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} MySQL uptime is less than 10 minutes.

trigger.name: MySQL: Server has aborted connections (over {$MYSQL.ABORTED_CONN.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} The number of failed attempts to connect to the MySQL server is more than {$MYSQL.ABORTED_CONN.MAX.WARN} in the last 5 minutes.

trigger.name: MySQL: Refused connections (max_connections limit reached)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} Number of refused connections due to the max_connections limit being reached.

trigger.name: MySQL: Server has slow queries (over {$MYSQL.SLOW_QUERIES.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} The number of slow queries is more than {$MYSQL.SLOW_QUERIES.MAX.WARN} in the last 5 minutes.
